result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Rogelio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 22CM1797.  Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute sobriety.

DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: Fine in the amount of $300.00.  All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA. Any cash bond on deposit shall be applied to costs.
Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Court advised defendant that as convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Rogelio

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Jesse Rogelio.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Case 22CM1797, with credit for 22 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation. 

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $300.00; 
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
Any cash bond on deposit shall be applied to costs. 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call.  Court withdraws stayed bench warrant.  Defendant has another pending matter, Court accepts transfer of case 22CM1797 for global resolution.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Calendar call on August 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  Defendant not present, out of custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Defense received global offering and requested calendar call date; defendant has another case 22CM1797.  Calendar call scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Jesse Rogelio not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting signature bond remains. Court sets $750 cash bond, same prior conditions. Case is adjourned Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Warrant/Bench Warrant served. An email was sent to the Public defender's office and district Attorney Office providing the next court date
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Jesse Rogelio not in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Defendant failed to appear for 1:30 p.m. scheduling conference.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  No bail forfeited at this time.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court with Attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Ochoa. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court with Attorney Conner Romenesko who appears on behalf of Charles Robert Roozen.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is out due to COVID. Defense objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:

Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse Rogelio

Prior: 2052 South 5th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Jesse Rogelio in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Jesse Rogelio in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesse Rogelio appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
